com.thesonofthom.tools.examples

Class ParseFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thesonofthom.tools.examples.ParseFile

  • public class ParseFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to execute a command line utility to parse various file types into human readable text dumps
    Author:
    Kevin Thomson

    • Method Detail

      • parseFile

        public static BufferMap parseFile(java.io.File file,
                  ParseFile.FileType type)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Parse the specified file as the specified file type
        Parameters:
        file - file to be parsed
        type - FileType to attempt to parse the file as
        Returns:
        BufferMap containing the parsed data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be read
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be parsed as that file type

      • parseFile

        public static BufferMap parseFile(java.io.File file)
        Attempts to parse the specified file as one of the types supported
        Parameters:
        file - file to be parsed
        Returns:
        BufferMap containing the parsed data, if successful, or null if the file could not be parsed

      • getExtension

        public static java.lang.String getExtension(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:
        the extension of the file, if any

      • getMostLikelyFileType

        public static ParseFile.FileType getMostLikelyFileType(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:
        the best-guess file type of the file, based strictly on the file's extension

      • dumpFileInfo

        public static void dumpFileInfo(java.io.File file,
                ParseFile.FileType fileType,
                boolean dumpDebug,
                java.lang.String outputDirectory)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Parse the file and dump the output to a text file in the specified output directory
        Parameters:
        file - the file to parse
        fileType - how to parse the file. if null, will try each supported type
        dumpDebug - whether to enable debug information in the dump
        outputDirectory - directory to save the output text to. If null, will use the same directory as the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
